skill.name: Quetrex Development Workflow Skill
skill.description: **Purpose:** Bootstrap new Claude Code sessions with complete Quetrex project context and enable efficient issue-driven development.
skill.summary: **Purpose:** Bootstrap new Claude Code sessions with complete Quetrex project context and enable eff...
skill.author: Barnhardt-Enterprises-Inc

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown content. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or filesystem access beyond its own file. This is a safe reference guide for project workflow.

content.user_title: Load Quetrex project context and workflow
content.value_statement: New Claude Code sessions lack project context. This skill provides complete Quetrex project documentation including architecture, issue workflows, quality gates, and AI agent automation patterns for immediate productivity.
actual_capabilities: Provides complete Quetrex project architecture and tech stack overview
Documents GitHub Actions AI agent workflow and trigger conditions
Defines issue creation standards for AI agent tasks
Establishes quality gates and testing requirements
Lists critical files and their purposes for quick reference
Presents development patterns and naming conventions
limitations: Does not execute GitHub CLI commands - only documents the commands
Does not modify or create files in the project
Does not connect to GitHub API or external services
Requires the Quetrex project structure to exist for full utility

use_cases.title: Initialize project context
use_cases.description: Load comprehensive project documentation when starting new Quetrex development sessions

use_cases.title: Create agent issues
use_cases.description: Follow standardized issue templates for delegating work to AI agents via GitHub Actions

use_cases.title: Understand patterns
use_cases.description: Learn Quetrex coding conventions, quality gates, and development workflows quickly

prompt_templates.title: Load project context
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the Quetrex Development Workflow skill and give me an overview of current pending issues and recent completed work

prompt_templates.title: Create feature issue
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the process for creating an ai-feature issue in Quetrex? Show me the template structure and labeling requirements

prompt_templates.title: Review quality gates
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the 6-layer quality defense system requirements and test coverage thresholds in Quetrex?

prompt_templates.title: Check architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the Quetrex 3-phase security architecture and how the agent execution flow works with Claude Code CLI

output_examples.input: What is the current project status and what issues are ready for AI agents?
output: â€¢ Pending AI agent issues: Use `gh issue list --label ai-feature --state open` to see ready tasks
â€¢ Recent completed work: Check merged PRs with `gh pr list --state merged --limit 10`
â€¢ Current phase: Check `.quetrex/status.yml` for roadmap position
â€¢ Key files: CLAUDE.md for context, docs/PROJECT-CHECKLIST.md for tasks
â€¢ Quality enforcement: 75% coverage minimum, TDD workflow required, 6-layer defense system

best_practices: Run the session checklist at the start of every new Claude Code session
Create well-structured issues with acceptance criteria before delegating to AI agents
Follow the TDD workflow: write failing tests first, then implement, then refactor
anti_patterns: Skipping issue creation and working directly without documented acceptance criteria
Combining multiple unrelated tasks in a single issue
Forgetting to add the ai-feature label which triggers the GitHub Actions automation

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It is designed for Claude Code CLI workflow integration.

faq.question: What are the execution limits for AI agents?
faq.answer: AI agent runs have a 45-minute max execution, 150 API calls limit, and 75 file changes maximum per issue.

faq.question: How do I integrate with GitHub Actions?
faq.answer: Create an issue with the ai-feature label to trigger the workflow. The agent runs in a secure Docker container with quality gates.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a documentation-only skill with no code execution. It reads only its own markdown content and provides reference information.

faq.question: Why did my AI agent run fail?
faq.answer: Check workflow runs with `gh run list --workflow=ai-agent.yml`. Common failures include timeout, coverage requirements, or linting errors.

faq.question: How does this compare to other workflow skills?
faq.answer: This skill is project-specific to Quetrex. Generic workflow skills provide general guidance while this contains exact commands and patterns for Quetrex.
